items.text: shifts his weight back because the ball is only on a good length and then punches it with the turn towards long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: another push towards long-on, but midwicket cuts across as well
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: waits on the good length ball on off stump a little more this time to try and turn it behind square leg. Still no luck with the single
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: there's the tossed up ball. After a few shorter ones to build pressure. Looking for a release shot, Hope?, asks Mehidy. Hope answers with a stout forward defensive
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: stays back to the length ball on middle and drills it to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: Nilesh: "@Vicky: You have a point here but what you miss is short form cricket of 2019 is very different to that of 1996. Pitches back then did have something for the bowlers. Besides that the 96 WC was played in the subcontinent with one ball per innings. "
items.text: too short and Hope just swivels on his back foot and pulls it down to the fine leg boundary. Easily done
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, FOUR runs

items.preText: Kapil Baldawa: "Bravo plays really poorly to begin with. Too many dots and the pressure is right back on his partners. I think he has to clear his mind and play naturally aggressively to succeed at this level. So much talent but so little intent early on"
items.text: whips a short ball outside off away to deep midwicket. Outstanding shot. Needs to wait for the ball, wait till it's right under his eyes to executed it perfectly and he does.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.text: dropped by Mehidy! He's at point, running in to try and get under a steepler. Poor shot from Bravo, going for an on the up loft over the bowler's head but being beaten for lack of pace. Mehidy tracks it. He's goes for it. But he's really nowhere near it, having to dive forward and in the end, he doesn't even get his hands to it
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, no run

items.text: nudges a shortish delivery behind square leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, 1 run

items.text: clips a shortish delivery on middle and off to short fine leg
items.postText: Morland: "My problem with Bravo as with most of the West Indian players is that they can't rotate the strike. A boundary per over is only good if it comes with singles."
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, 1 run

items.text: defends a shortish delivery on off stump to point
items.postText: Syed Kabir: "@Shahriar Add Younis Khan and Chanderpaul to that list. They have multiple double centuries against us, not just regular centuries. Kumar Sangakkara and Thisara Perera have also tormented us over the years."
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Bravo, no run

items.preText: Hassan: "Make up your mind commentators! Tendulkar can only be great if pitches were flat, but that means McGrath was bad and would not last on current flat pitches!"
items.text: bit of a leading edge as he tries to flick a tossed up ball on middle through mid-on. But it drifts away just a tiny bit and makes him get squared up. A tangled up block back to the bowler
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, no run

items.text: turns the ball on middle through midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: huge appeal for lbw and he has his man! Dropped him in the last over, traps him in this, with a slider on off stump. Bravo plays outside the line, looking for turn. There isn't any and he's pinned in front. Would probably have gone on to hit leg stump. At least in umpire Kettleborough's mind and we don't have DRS to get confirmation in this series.
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Bravo, OUT

dismissal.text: DM Bravo lbw b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 6 (19m 13b 1x4 0x6) SR: 46.15

items.text: lovely dip, and it happens at the last second too, making Hope reach in front of himself to try and make contact with the ball on off stump
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, no run

items.text: quicker delivery on off stump and Chase flicks it to midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, no run

items.text: a little too short that time and Chase has the opportunity to get off the mark with a punch to long-on
items.postText: Jack: "I think the role of those players who aren't smash and grab sloggers but those to work the ball for singles and twos, like a Root, Williamson and Babar Azam will be key come WC time"
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, 1 run

items.preText: PrashantBanjare: "There is a lot of talk going around Hope's strike rate but to me he is doing g good job because we need solidity at the top of the order only thing he should work on it is that finding the gaps with soft hands and scampering for quick singles just like the way Kohli does for India regularly"
items.text: huge lbw shout but umpire Neill thinks it might be sliding down. And he's right. Mashrafe finally gets his length right and the ball skids through as well, pitching on off stump and cutting into the right-hander, making him play across the line
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.text: drills it towards midwicket, where Mahmudullah falls over the ball and lets it through to the boundary
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, FOUR runs

items.text: shapes to cut the ball, sensing there's enough room for it, but Mashrafe gets it to nip into the right-hander again, surprising Chase
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.preText: RC Daniel: "I am a WINDIES supporter but Mr Bravo has failed yet again. How many more chances can we give him? When Mr Campbell recovers from his injury I believe that Mr Bravo will have to watch the game from the Pavillion. So much talent wasted."
items.text: gets forward to block with an open face outside off. Finds point
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.preText: Vicky: "@Nilesh - The short form is the T20 version. WC is still a 50 over game. And with this WC being played in English conditions, I am sure the pitches will offer more to the bowlers than what it did in the subcontinent back in 96. Also, even if the rules have changed, I am sure the fast bowlers wont complain as it offers them the advantage of swinging the new ball (although it negates the chances of reverse swinging). Its a win-win for the batsman as well as the bowlers." --- You do realise it's not even two days since 375 played 360 in England, right?
items.text: hits him on the thigh as Mashrafe hits the deck outside off and getting it to seam into Chase, hurry into him.
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.text: another lbw appeal but umpire Neill says too high. Oooh, this is good stuff. Mashrafe's finally warmed up. He should be having bowled six overs and his indippers are causing all sorts of problems. Too much movement off the pitch keeps catching the batsman stuck in his crease, panicking and playing across the line
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Chase, no run

items.text: leans forward, getting to the pitch of the ball on middle and driving it to long-on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Hope, 1 run

items.text: gets it past the right of slip. Not convincing, but it's still runs on the board. An intentional back foot glide, even though danger lurks. What's Chase thinking...
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Chase, FOUR runs
